SGLanguage.EnterSomeInfoToGetStarted: Enter some information to get started!
SGLanguage.AreYouSureDeleteUser: Are you sure you want to delete this user?
SGLanguage.AreYouSureDeleteUsers: Are you sure you want to delete these {0} users?
SGLanguage.FailedToResolveSIDViaWMI: Failed to resolve an SID via WMI.
SGLanguage.FailedToWriteErrorToWindow: Failed to write error message to main window.
SGLanguage.FailedToQueryWMI: Failed to query WMI, {0} might have a corrupt WMI installation. Try to run the command "winmgmt.exe /resetrepository" on the target PC to resolve this issue. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/wmisdk/winmgmt
SGLanguage.FailedToWaitForRemoteProcess: Failed to wait for remote process {0} to finish.
SGLanguage.FailedToWatchRemoteLog: Failed to watch remote log file at {0}.
SGLanguage.FailedToWriteStoreParameterTo: Failed to write store parameter(s) to {0}.
SGLanguage.FailedToDownloadUSMT: Failed to automatically download USMT from the web, please download USMT and update the SuperGrate.xml accordingly.
SGLanguage.FailedToTransferUserStateTo: Failed to transfer user state to {0}.
SGLanguage.FailedToFindUSMTFolderAt: Failed to find USMT folder at {0}.
SGLanguage.FailedToDeleteUSMTAttempt: Failed to delete USMT, the process may still be running, trying periodically: Attempt {0}/{1}.
SGLanguage.FailedToConnectToViaWMI: Failed to connect to {0} via WMI. Make sure the remote PC is online.
SGLanguage.FailedToConnectToViaWMIAccessDenied: Failed to connect to {0} via WMI because access was denied. Make sure your user account has administrative access to the remote PC.
SGLanguage.FailedToReadSIDFromStoreID: Failed to read SID from store ID {0}.
SGLanguage.FailedToReadUserFromStoreID: Failed to read user from store ID {0}.
SGLanguage.FailedToDeleteUserFromTheStore: Failed to delete {0} from the store.
SGLanguage.FailedToStopUserDeleteAgentOn: Failed to stop user delete agent on {0}.
SGLanguage.FailedToGatherOSArchitectureOn: Failed to gather OS architecture on {0}.
SGLanguage.FailedToGenerateMUParameter: Failed to generate MU parameter for USMT.
SGLanguage.FailedToWriteLogToDisk: Failed to write log to disk.
SGLanguage.FailedToSaveConfigurationToDisk: Failed to save SuperGrate.xml to disk.
SGLanguage.OSArchitectureIsNotSupported: The OS architecture {0} is not supported.
SGLanguage.UserSuccessfullyDeletedFromTheStore: User {0} successfully deleted from the store.
SGLanguage.CopyingUserDeleteAgentToRemotePC: Copying user delete agent to remote PC {0}...
SGLanguage.RemovingUserDeleteAgentFromRemotePC: Removing user delete agent from remote PC {0}...
SGLanguage.UserDeleteAgentHasBeenStoppedOn: User delete agent has been stopped on {0}.
SGLanguage.SkippedSIDMissingProfile: Skipped SID without a profile directory on the remote PC {0}.
SGLanguage.ThisProgramIsAttemptingToClose: This program is attempting to close, attempt {0}/{1}.
SGLanguage.SavingDataToMigrationStore: Saving user data to migration store...
SGLanguage.SuperGrateXMLLoadedButIsUsingDefaults: Config loaded, but is using default values for the missing elements. You can fix this warning by saving the current settings.
SGLanguage.ConfigCommentUSMTPath: The UNC or direct path to the USMT directory. (E.g: .\USMT\X64)
SGLanguage.ConfigCommentPayloadPath: Local path on source computer where Super Grate will run USMT from. (E.g: C:\SuperGrate)
SGLanguage.ConfigCommentMigrationStorePath: The UNC or direct path to the USMT migration store. (E.g: \\ba-share\s$ or .\STORE)
SGLanguage.ConfigCommentAutoDeleteFromStore: Delete the user from the migration store after a restore? (Store to destination)
SGLanguage.ConfigCommentAutoDeleteFromSource: Delete the user from the source computer after a backup? (Source to store)
SGLanguage.ConfigCommentHideBuiltInAccounts: Prevent NT AUTHORITY and NT SERVICE accounts from being listed?
SGLanguage.ConfigCommentHideUnknownSIDs: Prevent unknown accounts from being listed?
SGLanguage.ConfigCommentDumpLogHere: Write log to disk on exit. (Leave blank to disable) (E.g: \\ba-share\s$\Logs or .\Logs)
SGLanguage.ConfigCommentULColumns: List of columns to display for the source or store users.
SGLanguage.ConfigCommentULViewMode: User list view mode. (E.g: Large (0) / Small Icon (2), List (3), Details (1) and Tile (4))
SGLanguage.ConfigCommentTabView: Default tab view at startup (E.g: Source, Store or None)
SGLanguage.ConfigCommentSecurityProtocol: Security protocol version (Restart required) (E.g: SystemDefault, Ssl3, Tls, Tls11, Tls12 or Tls13)
